concerns.description: Data collected without user consent
concerns.reasoning: The attention tracking feature was implemented without obtaining user consent, which violates the principle of collecting data only with permission.
related_questions: Was any form of consent obtained from users at any point?
Were users informed about the data collection before it began?

concerns.description: Accuracy and relevance of collected data
concerns.reasoning: The data collected was specific to whether the Zoom application was in focus, which may not accurately reflect participant engagement or attention.
related_questions: How was the accuracy of attention data ensured?
Was there any verification process for the relevance of collected data?

concerns.description: Lack of clear purpose communicated to users
concerns.reasoning: The feature was implemented to provide engagement insights to hosts but was not clearly communicated to users, leading to backlash.
related_questions: Was the purpose of data collection explicitly communicated to users?
How was the purpose aligned with users' expectations?

concerns.description: Data used without user control or awareness
concerns.reasoning: Participants had no control over the use of their attention data, and it was used to generate reports for hosts.
related_questions: Were there any limits on how the collected data could be used?
Did users have any say in how their data was utilized?

concerns.description: Lack of encryption for collected data
concerns.reasoning: The data was stored in plain text, indicating inadequate security measures for protecting participant information.
related_questions: Was any encryption method considered for the data?
Why was the data stored without encryption?

concerns.description: Lack of transparency about data collection practices
concerns.reasoning: Zoom did not adequately disclose the presence and functionalities of the attention tracking feature to users.
related_questions: Was there any public documentation about the feature before its implementation?
How were users informed about the feature after backlash?

concerns.description: No user control over data collection and sharing
concerns.reasoning: Users could not manage or control the collection or sharing of their attention data, leading to privacy concerns.
related_questions: Were there any tools provided to users to manage their data?
Could users opt-out of data collection or sharing?

concerns.description: Inadequate accountability measures for privacy violations
concerns.reasoning: The implementation and subsequent removal of the feature suggest insufficient accountability for privacy breaches.
related_questions: What accountability mechanisms were in place for privacy violations?
How did Zoom address the privacy concerns raised by users?
